net.objectzoo.ebc.join

Class JoinProcessAndSignal<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.ebc.join.JoinProcessAndSignal<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the in and output type of the process flow that is joined
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanProcess<T>, CanStart, ProcessAndResultFlow<T,T>, SendsResult<T>, StartAndResultFlow<T>

    public class JoinProcessAndSignal<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProcessAndResultFlow<T,T>, StartAndResultFlow<T>
    This is a special flow EBC implementation that joins together a process and a signal flow and thus implements the interfaces ProcessAndResultFlow and StartAndResultFlow. The EBC waits for every input to be set at least once before creating a result event. Once both inputs have been set an output is created and sent. After that there are two different modes of operation depending on the resetAfterResultEvent parameter setting. If resetAfterResultEvent is set to true (which is the default) then after each result event the two input values are reset and the procedure to wait for both inputs starts from the beginning. If resetAfterResultEvent is set to false then for each following single input invocation a new output is created and sent until the EBC is manually reset again. If reset the procedure to wait for both inputs starts from the beginning. To manually reset the EBC the resetAction() can be invoked.
    Author:
    tilmann
